channel.title: Iran
channel.description:
Political and military officers, as well as weapons of mass destruction specialists at the State Department, are now advising Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice that the diplomatic approach favored by Burns has failed and the administration must actively prepare for military intervention of some kind.
[url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,296450,00.html]Article[/url]
Iran’s good policy: Stop accepting payments in dollars... ...In a deal announced last week, Japan's Nippon Oil agreed to buy oil from Iran using yen instead of the traditional U.S. dollars. The agreement comes after years of Iranian efforts to shift its petroleum exports away from dollars and toward yen and euros.
[url=http://www.tehrantimes.com/index_View.asp?code=152713]Article[/url]
While no longer under the illusion of the type of large-scale "democratic" intervention that precipitated the current Iraq war, neo-conservatives still appear to be pumping up a confrontational attitude between the US and Iran, painting the regime as an existential enemy with whom one cannot negotiate, a fanatical yet militarily weak reactionary government that desires the destruction of the world.
[url=http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Middle_East/II12Ak01.html]Article[/url]
The Bush administration believes it has inherent authority to launch unilateral military operations against Iran — even in the absence of a direct attack or a compelling, immediate threat to the United States — without the consent of the Congress. As a top priority, Congress needs to pass the Webb Amendment (S. 759), which would prohibit the use of funds for military operations in Iran without the consent of Congress.
[url=http://www.kansascity.com/273/story/271135.html]Article[/url]
Senator Joseph I. Lieberman, among the US Senate's fiercest hawks, has once again asked for the expansion of US invasion into Iran. "Is it time to give you authority, in pursuit of your mission in Iraq, to pursue those Iranian Quds Force operations in Iranian territory, in order to protect American troops in Iraq," Lieberman asked at a hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee.
[url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=22807§ionid=351020101]Article[/url] After another blazing hot summer the rhetoric floating around Washington on the subject of Iran is more fierce than ever, as oil hits record high prices on supply concerns (no connection there :rolleyes:). But will there be war? Is it all just a nuclear bluff? Will there be another 9/11 to justify the war?

What ever happened to popular sovereignty? Why not just leave other countries to rule inside their borders as they want? As long as they dont break international law, we have no reason to invade.
[/quote]

If we’re still on the WW2 discussion, we had reason.

If we’re on the Iran subject, go with whatever your friend told you.[/quote]
ya I went back to Iran
and what friend?

item.title: Iran
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:18, topic:142562”][quote author=MastrChief link=topic=195002.msg1752819#msg1752819 date=1189658650]
Go back in time and tell President Roosevelt not to help out in WW2. Will you be happy afterwards?
[/quote]

I don’t think he was too spectacular.[/quote]

My point wasn’t the president, it was the war.

[quote=“Bang Train, post:19, topic:142562”][quote author=MastrChief link=topic=195002.msg1752819#msg1752819 date=1189658650]

Altough I like the US (in some ways I dont) they should stop interfering in other countrys. This attitude of the US that they always feel threathened caused the shit they are in. It all started with them fucking up Palestina. (Im not arabic and I dont really like anyone from arabic countrys. Helping the jews wasnt smart.)

Go back in time and tell President Roosevelt not to help out in WW2. Will you be happy afterwards?
[/quote]
We weren’t helping others until Pearl Harbor which brought us into it.

Rest of the time we were exploiting the war for money by selling guns and shit to allies.[/quote]

The U.S. was a half and half country. Half wanted to stay isolated, the other half wanted to end this war, pearl harbor is just what set us off.

Read full topic
